bug.short_desc: mintMenu isn't ported to gtk+-3 on Fedora 25 MATE
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: After upgrade to Fedora 25, mintMenu is gone and cannot be added again (nothing happens).
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): mintmenu-5.6.5-4.fc24.noarch
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install mintmenu and trying adding it to the panel
Actual results: Nothing
Expected results: Menu appears
Additional info: Judging by the version, mintmenu was not updated since F24. I suspect it should be rebuilt with GTK3 (or some other dependencies).
Any help will be much appreciated. I don't find the default menu even remotely usable :(
There seem to be quite a few releases since 5.6.5, maybe worth updating as well: https://github.com/linuxmint/mintmenu/blob/master/debian/changelog

Mate is switched to gtk+-3 but mintmenu isn't ported to gtk3. The replacement is new mate-menu. Do 'dnf install mate-menu' and load it to the panel. At the momment i am not sure if i drop mintmenu or wait that linuxmint port it to gtk3. For this reason i leave the report open for other people.
mate-menu works reasonably well, thanks for the hint!
*** Bug 1399376 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
mintmenu-5.8.1-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2cc68a7ea3
mintmenu-5.8.1-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-22e7274d04

mintmenu-5.8.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2cc68a7ea3

mintmenu-5.8.1-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-22e7274d04
mintmenu-5.8.1-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
mintmenu-5.8.1-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
